column4: hello everyone I have some questions..I have a new server and I want to put back my websites and my data base how can I do that ?
Most of the web stuff would reside in your htdocs directory (or /var/www for instance), as for databases use mysqldump or whatnot
I've copy/paste the files on the /var/www but..do not work..
how can I get them back ?!
That, and dump mysql databases if any...
the web sites do not work..
How can I get them back to work ?
That's your problem, I don't know what you're talking about, I don't know your exact setup... But are HTTPD and MySQLd started?
what you do not understand ?
Well different websites set things up differently, so there's that... It may be using mySQL, it may be using a flatfile database, it may be using sqlite, it might not be using a database at all...
First I want to get my websites back.
can you help ?
I just told you that I can't. Three times in a row >.<
I put them on var/www and they do not work.
for i in apache2 mysql ; do sudo service $i start ; done # To start apache and mysql. But if that doesn't help then you messed something up when transferring files.
I just put the old www instate of the new www.
How many times did I tell you to dump mysql databases
Well, mysql databases can't be just "copied over" as files, you have to use specific commands ("mysqldump" and, if I recall right, "mysqlrestore")
You didn't set up PHP did you -_-
You're not telling us anything about your setup and expect us to help.

Stop complaining. Explain: Which webservers you have installed, which modules/plugins, which database architectures, what did you do to transfer them, whether there are major version differences or not...
